## Time Series
I will use ARIMA model to solve this question.
For further explaination about the model,please check here. [wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autoregressive_integrated_moving_average)

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import statsmodels.api as sm

%matplotlib inline

# read csv file
pd_file = pd.read_csv('part_2_timeseries.csv')
pd_file = pd_file.dropna()

# convert date as index
pd_file['invoice_date'] = pd.to_datetime(pd_file['invoice_date'])
pd_file.set_index('invoice_date', inplace=True)
pd_file.head()

# Look for the best ARIMA prameters

import itertools
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore") # specify to ignore warning messages

# Define the p, d and q parameters to take any value between 0 and 2
p = d = q = range(0, 2)
 
# Generate all different combinations of p, q and q triplets
pdq = list(itertools.product(p, d, q))
print(pdq)
 
# Generate all different combinations of seasonal p, q and q triplets
seasonal_pdq = [(x[0], x[1], x[2], 12) for x in list(itertools.product(p, d, q))]
print(seasonal_pdq)

#Look for the lowest AIC
aic = {}
for param in pdq:
    for param_seasonal in seasonal_pdq:
        model = sm.tsa.statespace.SARIMAX(pd_file, order=param, seasonal_order=param_seasonal, enforce_stationarity=False, enforce_invertibility=False)
        results = model.fit()
        model_key = 'ARIMA{}x{}'.format(param, param_seasonal)
        aic[model_key] = results.aic

#print(model_key, results.aic)
print(min(aic, key=aic.get))

# Putting the parameters we found to the SARIMAX model
model = sm.tsa.statespace.SARIMAX(pd_file, order=(0, 1, 1), seasonal_order=(0, 1, 1, 12), enforce_stationarity=False, enforce_invertibility=False)
results = model.fit()
print(results.summary().tables[1])

From the summary table, we recevie much information. We will focuse on P value in each row.Each value is samller than 0.005. The lower P value, the greater the statistical significance of the obvserved difference.
We first compare the predicted value with the actual value of the time series, which will help us understand the accuracy of our forecast.

# After setting up the modelï¼Œstart to predicting from June 1st 2015.Dynamic=False
pred = results.get_prediction(start=pd.to_datetime('2015-06-01'), dynamic=False)
pred_ci = pred.conf_int()

ax = pd_file.plot(label='Observed',figsize=(12, 6))
pred.predicted_mean.plot(ax=ax, label='One-step ahead Forecast', alpha=.7)
 
ax.fill_between(pred_ci.index,
                pred_ci.iloc[:, 0],
                pred_ci.iloc[:, 1], color='k', alpha=.3)
 
ax.set_xlabel('invoice_date')
ax.set_ylabel('net_weight')
plt.legend()

plt.savefig('One-step ahead Forecast.png')
plt.show()

#After setting up the modelï¼Œstart to predicting from June 1st 2015.Dynamic=True

pred_dynamic = results.get_prediction(start=pd.to_datetime('2015-06-01'), dynamic=True, full_results=True)
pred_dynamic_ci = pred_dynamic.conf_int()

ax = pd_file.plot(label='Observed',figsize=(12, 6))
pred_dynamic.predicted_mean.plot(label='Dynamic Forecast', ax=ax)

ax.fill_between(pred_dynamic_ci.index,
                pred_dynamic_ci.iloc[:, 0],
                pred_dynamic_ci.iloc[:, 1], color='k', alpha=.25)
 
ax.fill_betweenx(ax.get_ylim(), pd.to_datetime('2015-6-1'), pd_file.index[-1],
                 alpha=.1, zorder=-1)
 
ax.set_xlabel('invoice_date')
ax.set_ylabel('net_weight')

plt.legend()
plt.savefig('Dynamic Forecast.png')
plt.show()

# Use the fitting model to make predictions starting from June 8th,2015.

# Get forecast several steps ahead in future
pred_uc = results.get_forecast(steps=7)
 
# Get confidence intervals of forecasts
pred_ci = pred_uc.conf_int()

ax = pd_file.plot(label='Observed', figsize=(12, 6))
pred_ = pred_uc.predicted_mean
pred_ = pred_.append(pd_file[-1:]['net_weight']).sort_index()
pred_.plot(ax=ax, label='Forecast')
# pred_uc.predicted_mean.plot(ax=ax, label='Forecast')
# ax.fill_between(pred_ci.index,
#                 pred_ci.iloc[:, 0],
#                 pred_ci.iloc[:, 1], color='k', alpha=.25)
ax.set_xlabel('invoice_date')
ax.set_ylabel('net_weight')
 
plt.legend()
plt.savefig('predict new 7 days.png')
plt.show()
The next 7 days demand showing from above.
